15.32: Let Christ, the King of the Jews, come down from the cross. We want to see it and then we will believe.” Those who were on the crosses beside Jesus spoke bad things to Him.
15.33: From noon until three o’clock it was dark over all the land.
15.34: At three o’clock Jesus cried with a loud voice, “My God, My God, why have You left Me alone?”
15.35: When some of those who stood by heard that, they said, “Listen! He is calling for Elijah.”
15.36: One of them ran and took a sponge and filled it with sour wine. He put it on a stick and gave it to Him to drink. He said, “Let Him alone. Let us see if Elijah will come and take Him down.”
15.37: Then Jesus gave a loud cry. He gave up His spirit and died.
15.38: The curtain in the house of God was torn in two from top to bottom.
15.39: The captain of the soldiers was looking at Jesus when He cried out. He saw Him die and said, “For sure, this Man was the Son of God.”
15.40: Women were looking on from far away. Among them was Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of the younger James and of Joses, and Salome.
15.41: These cared for Him when He was in the country of Galilee. There were many other women there who had followed Him to Jerusalem.
15.42: It was the day to get ready for the Day of Rest and it was now evening.
15.43: Joseph, who was from the city of Arimathea, was an important man in the court. He was looking for the holy nation of God. Without being afraid, he went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
15.44: Pilate was surprised and wondered if Jesus was dead so soon. He called the captain of the soldiers and asked if Jesus was already dead.
15.45: After the captain said that Jesus was dead, Pilate let Joseph take the body.
15.46: Joseph took the body of Jesus down from the cross. He put the linen cloth he had bought around the body. Then he laid the body in a grave which had been cut out in the side of a rock. He pushed a stone over to cover the door of the grave.
15.47: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses saw where He was laid.

16.1: The Day of Rest was over. Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices. They wanted to put the spices on Jesus’ body.
16.2: Very early in the morning on the first day of the week, they came to the grave. The sun had come up.
16.3: They said to themselves, “Who will roll the stone away from the door of the grave for us?”
16.4: But when they looked, they saw the very large stone had been rolled away.
16.5: They went into the grave. There they saw a young man with a long white coat sitting on the right side. They were afraid.
16.6: He said, “Do not be afraid. You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth Who was nailed to a cross. He is risen! He is not here! See, here is the place where they laid Him.
16.7: Go and tell His followers and Peter that He is going ahead of you into Galilee. You will see Him there as He told you.”
16.8: They ran from the grave shaking and were surprised. They did not say anything to anyone because they were afraid.
16.9: (It was early on the first day of the week when Jesus was raised from the dead. Mary Magdalene saw Him first. He had put seven demons out of her.
16.10: She went and told His followers. They were crying because of much sorrow.
16.11: But they did not believe her when she said she had seen Him alive.
16.12: After that He was seen again by two of His followers as they walked into the country. He did not look like He had looked before to these two people.
16.13: They went and told it to the others. The others did not believe them.
16.14: Later He was seen by the eleven followers as they were eating. He spoke to them with sharp words because they did not believe and their hearts were hard. And they did not believe the others who had seen Him since He had been raised from the dead.
16.15: He said to them, “You are to go to all the world and preach the Good News to every person.
16.16: He who puts his trust in Me and is baptized will be saved from the punishment of sin. But he who does not put his trust in Me is guilty and will be punished forever.
16.17: These special powerful works will be done by those who have put their trust in Me. In My name they will put out demons. They will speak with languages they have never learned.
16.18: They will pick up snakes. If they drink any poison, it will not hurt them. They will put their hands on the sick and they will be healed.”
16.19: After Jesus had talked to them, He was taken up into heaven. He sat down on the right side of God.
16.20: The followers went from there and preached everywhere. The Lord worked with them. The Lord showed that the Word of God was true by the special works they had power to do.)
